Latest posts

Cleaning of and making an interactive choropleth map from weather data

October 06, 2015

I will be using some weather data from NOAA, which I will clean up in order to check the human (fatalities & injuries) and economic (crop & property damage) impact due to weather events for each state, stretching from 1950-2011. The first part will be cleaning the data and the second part will be making interactive choropleth maps of our observations.

Read more here

Reproducible Research - Weather impact in the US

September 29, 2015

Storms and other severe weather events can cause both public health and economic problems for communities and municipalities. Many severe events can result in fatalities, injuries, and property damage, and preventing such outcomes to the extent possible is a key concern.

Read more here

Who am I?

A mechanical engineer who turned into an analyst, who is now working towards becoming a data scientist. I have always been interested in statistics, math and solving complex problems, and over the last year I have started to dig deeper into the world of big data.
Most of my work will be posted on this website for anyone to read.

If you want to know more about me, you can click here
